intro: Forsteronia amblybasis subsp. decipiens, commonly known as the false sandmat, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cactaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with pale green, fleshy stems that store water. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters during the warmer months. This subspecies is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, showcasing features such as reduced leaves and thick, waxy cuticles to minimize water loss.
